intro: Mitrephora amdjahii, commonly known as the Kauai mitrephora, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the montane forests of Kauai. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
